paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Of the overall early-onset and late-onset Val30Met, non-Val30Met and WT-ATTR, 10%, 62%, 70% and 96%, had moderate or severe IVST, respectively.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays not detailed in the paper.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most frequent mutation reported to cause ATTR.
key_quotes: Val30Met mutation alone accounted for 50% of the m-ATTR subpopulation.

Older age, male gender, cardiac symptoms, history of heart failure, higher brain natriuretic peptide (BNP) values, conduction abnormalities, low voltage and pathological Q waves, were more frequent in the moderate and severe IVST classes.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline demographic, genetic, echocardiographic, ECG and biological parameters with respect to the four IVST classes.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data focused on TTR variants and penetrance information.
